## Create ssh tunnel and connect to the remote mongo database on command line

Assume followings:

`/mykeys/.ssh/prodserver.pem` - is a certificate file

`umid` - is a user name

`111.111.111.111` - is a remote host, that mongodb runs

`2222` - is a remote port to connect via ssh

`localhost:27017` - local host and port on remote machine

`27018` - local port


```
ssh -i /mykeys/.ssh/prodserver.pem umid@111.111.111.111 -p 2222 -Nf -L 27018:localhost:27017
```

Connect to the mongodb via opened tunnel, in this case `mydb` is database name
```
mongo --port 27018 mydb
```

### Installing Yii2

```
mkdir app3.uz
cd app3.uz
composer global require fxp/composer-asset-plugin --no-plugins
composer create-project --prefer-dist yiisoft/yii2-app-basic .
```

### Set the application root path via .htaccess

Create `.htaccess` file in the application root folder.
```conf
RewriteEngine On
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} !^web
RewriteRule ^(.*)$ web/$1 [L]
```

Also create `.htaccess` file in the `/web/` folder:
```conf
RewriteEngine on
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-f
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-d
RewriteRule . index.php
```

Adjusting URL generation (removing `/web/` part from generated URLs):

In file `config/web.php` set base URL to empty string, also enable `urlManager` component:
```php
<?php
    // ...
    'components' => [
        'request' => [
            'baseUrl' => '', // <--- set base URL
            // ...
        ],
        // ...
        'urlManager' => [
            'enablePrettyUrl' => true,

```

### Build Web Server image

#### Dockerfile to create web server image

Dockerfile:
```
FROM ubuntu:yakkety
MAINTAINER Umidjons <almatov.us@gmail.com>

WORKDIR /

RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
		vim \
		curl \
		git \
		software-properties-common

ENV NVM_VERSION v0.31.2
ENV NODE_VERSION 6.3.0

RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
		python2.7 \
		python2.7-dev \
		build-essential \
		libssl-dev

RUN rm /bin/sh \
	&& ln -s /bin/bash /bin/sh \
	&& curl -sL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/creationix/nvm/$NVM_VERSION/install.sh -o install_nvm.sh \
	&& bash install_nvm.sh \
	&& . /root/.nvm/nvm.sh \
	&& nvm install $NODE_VERSION \
	&& npm config set python /usr/bin/python2.7 \
	&& npm install pm2 -g \
	&& git config --global user.name "Umidjons" \
	&& git config --global user.email "almatov.us@gmail.com" \
	&& git clone https://github.com/umidjons/micro-clinic.git \
	&& cd micro-clinic/ \
	&& npm install \
	&& npm install -g bower \
	&& bower install --allow-root --force-latest

VOLUME /root/.pm2/logs

WORKDIR /micro-clinic/

EXPOSE 3000
CMD ["pm2", "start", "server.js"]
```

Build command:
```bash
$ docker build -f Dockerfile -t starmed/webserver:1.0 .
```

### Dump & Restore database

Dump database on host machine I use following command:
```bash
$ mongodump --db starmed --out dbdumps/15072016171000
```

Note, number 15072016171000 means 15.07.2016 17:10:00.

Run database image with dumps volume
```bash
$ docker run -d --name db --net starmed-network -v /data/db:/data/db -v /data/configdb:/data/configdb -v /home/superuser/StarmedDist/Dumps:/data/dumps mongo:3.2.8
```

`/home/superuser/StarmedDist/Dumps` on host machine points to `/data/dumps` on docker container.

Then run mongo restore on that container:
```bash
$ docker exec db mongorestore -d starmed /data/dumps/15072016171000/starmed
```

`db` is container name
`-d` is mongorestore option, it specified database name to import

### PREPARE NETWORK

Create network for docker containers
```bash
docker network create starmed-network
```

### RUNNING MONGO IN DOCKER CONTAINER

Pull mongo image:
```bash
docker pull mongo:3.2.8
```

Run container:
```bash
docker run -d \
	--name db \
	--net starmed-network \
	-v /data/db:/data/db \
	-v /data/configdb:/data/configdb \
	-v /home/superuser/StarmedDist/Dumps:/data/dumps \
	mongo:3.2.8
```

Container name is: db
Network is: starmed-network
Mounted volumes: 
	For database files: /data/db -> /data/db
						/data/configdb -> /data/configdb
	For dumps: /home/superuser/StarmedDist/Dumps -> /data/dumps

Restore dump example:
```bash
docker exec db mongorestore -d starmed /data/dumps/15072016171000/starmed
```

### RUNNING APP IN DOCKER CONTAINER

Docker file `Dockerfile_node` to build App container:
```Dockerfile
FROM node:6
MAINTAINER Umidjons <almatov.us@gmail.com>

WORKDIR /

RUN npm install -g pm2

# copy current directory contents from build context into app directory
COPY . /usr/src/app

WORKDIR /usr/src/app

# pm2 logs
VOLUME /root/.pm2/logs

EXPOSE 3000
CMD ["pm2", "start", "server.js", "-i", "0", "--no-daemon"]

Build image:
```bash
cd /home/me/dist/app/
docker build -f Dockerfile_node -t ws:1.0 .
```

```bash
mkdir /var/log/pm2
docker run -d --name ws --net starmed-network -p 80:3000 -v /var/log/pm2:/root/.pm2/logs ws:1.0
```

Stop container:

docker stop ws

comment on column my_table.col_3 is 'Third column comment.';

`MailSender.php` is long running task. Only one instance of the script must

LOG_FILE="$JOBS_PATH/log/$NAME.log"
LOCK_FILE="$JOBS_PATH/$NAME.lock"

content:
Build following SQL statement with QueryBuilder

```sql
select distinct property_id
from notices n
join person_info i on (n.id=i.notice_id and i.type=1)
join property2notice p on (p.notice_id=n.id)
where n.status=1 and i.tin=1122334
```

```php
<?php
	public function actionSearchInfo($data, $type = "t") // t-by tin, p-by pin
	{
		$qb = Yii::app()->db->createCommand()
			->selectDistinct('property_id')
			->from('notices n')
			->join('person_info i', 'n.id=i.notice_id and i.type=1')
			->join('property2notice p', 'p.notice_id=n.id')
			->where('n.status=1');
		if(!empty($data))
			if($type == "t")
				$qb->andWhere('i.tin=:tin', [':tin' => $data]);
			elseif($type == "p")
				$qb->andWhere('i.pin=:pin', [':pin' => $data]);
		$ids = $qb->queryColumn();
		Yii::log('data: '.print_r($ids, true));
	}
```

description: Creating PDF thumbnails in PHP
content:
Creating PDF thumbnails in PHP
==

Install Ghostscript
===

Download and install right version of [ghostscript](http://www.ghostscript.com/download/gsdnld.html). In my case my PHP was x86 architecture, so I download `Ghostscript 9.14 for Windows (32 bit)`.

Enable ImageMagick
===

Check, is `imagick` extension available and loaded.

This line should be present in your `php.ini`:
```ini
extension=php_imagick.dll
```

Also, check `php_imagick.dll` in PHP's `ext` directory.

PHP function
===

```php
<?php
	function genPdfThumbnail($source, $target)
	{
		//$source = realpath($source);
		$target = dirname($source).DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR.$target;
		$im     = new Imagick($source."[0]"); // 0-first page, 1-second page
		$im->setImageColorspace(255); // prevent image colors from inverting
		$im->setimageformat("jpeg");
		$im->thumbnailimage(160, 120); // width and height
		$im->writeimage($target);
		$im->clear();
		$im->destroy();
	}
```

Call that function:

```php
<?php
genPdfThumbnail('/uploads/my.pdf','my.jpg'); // generates /uploads/my.jpg
```

content:
# Multilingual application name

We can't directly translate application name in config files as following:

```php
<?php
return [
	'basePath'       => dirname( __FILE__ ) . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR . '..',
	'name'           => Yii::t('domain', 'My Application'), // this doesn't work!!!
	// ...
];
```

But we can use workaround here, instead of translating application name in configuration file, we translate it in using places, for example, in layouts.

In configuration file just use original/primary language:

```php
<?php
return [
	'basePath'       => dirname( __FILE__ ) . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR . '..',
	'name'           => 'My Application', // do not translate here!!!
	// ...
];
```

Then in layout use this code with `Yii::t()` call:

```php
<title><?php echo CHtml::encode( Yii::t( 'domain', Yii::app()->name ) . ' - ' . $this->pageTitle ); ?></title>
```

Do not forget to include translation in `protected/messages/LANG_CODE/domain.php` files. For russian it well be `protected/messages/ru/domain.php` with this content:

```php
<?php
return array (
	'My Application' => 'ÐÐ¾Ñ Ð¿ÑÐ¸Ð»Ð¾Ð¶ÐµÐ½Ð¸Ñ',
	// ...
];
```

### Generate translation files

Create configuration file for translations `protected/config/messages.php` with following content:

```php
<?php
return [
	'sourcePath'  => '/var/www/mywebapp/protected', // look for sources here
	'messagePath' => '/var/www/mywebapp/protected/messages', // generate translation files here
	'languages'  =>['ru','uz'],
	'fileTypes'  =>['php','js'],
	'exclude'    =>['.git'],
	'translator' =>['Yii::t','$.Yii.t'], // Yii::t() for PHP, $.Yii.t() for JS
	'removeOld'  =>true, // remove old unused entries, instead of mark them as @@
	'overwrite'  =>true, // overwrite translated files
	'sort'       =>true, // sort by key
];
```
For information about `$.Yii.t()` look https://gist.github.com/umidjons/9888711.

Then we can issue `yiic` command to generate translations specifying above file:

```sh
cd /var/www/mywebapp
yiic message protected/config/messages.php
```

Now we can open generated files and type translations.

description: Yii: Add additional `data-` attributes to each row in `CGridView`
content:
# Add additional `data-` attributes to each row in `CGridView`

Sometimes we need to hold some values from model in `data-` attributes of tag. But we can't use `$data` special variable in cell's `htmlOptions` attributes. Instead of holding data in cell, we can generate `data-` attributes for rows (`tr`). For this purpose `CGridView` has special attribute `rowHtmlOptionsExpression`.

```php
<?php
$this->widget( 'zii.widgets.grid.CGridView',
[
	'id'                       => 'my-grid',
	'dataProvider'             => $model->search(),
	'filter'                   => null,
	'itemsCssClass'            => 'table table-striped table-hover table-condensed',
	'template'                 => '{items}{pager}',
	'columns'                  =>
		[
			[
				'name'        => 'id',
				'htmlOptions' => [ 'class' => 'id' ],
			],
			[
				'name'        => 'animal_class',
				'value'       => 'AnimalClass::visualValues( $data->animal_class )', // class name, not class ID
				'htmlOptions' => [ 'class' => 'animal-class', ],
			],
			[
				'name'        => 'title',
				'htmlOptions' => [ 'class' => 'title' ],
			],
		],
	'rowHtmlOptionsExpression' => '[ "data-animalclass" => $data->animal_class, ]', // <tr data-animalclass = "123">
] );
```

Access `data-animalclass` property using jQuery.

```js
// $(this) - clicked link in the row or, for example, button in the CButtonColumn.
var row=$(this).closest('tr'),
	animalClassID=row.data('animalclass');
console.log('Animal class ID:', animalClassID);
```

# Configuring number format & using in CGridView column

We can configure numbers format in application configuration as below:

```php
<?php
return [
	// ...
	'components'     => [
		// ...
		'format'        => [
			// number format
			'numberFormat'   => [ 'decimals' => 2, 'decimalSeparator' => '.', 'thousandSeparator' => false ],
			
			// date time formats
			'datetimeFormat' => 'd.m.Y H:i:s',
			'dateFormat'     => 'd.m.Y',
		],
	],
];
```

In CGridView we can set columns' format as follow:

```php
<?php $this->widget( 'zii.widgets.grid.CGridView', [
	'id'            => 'service-grid',
	'dataProvider'  => $model->search(),
	'filter'        => null,
	'itemsCssClass' => 'table table-striped table-hover table-condensed',
	'template'      => '{items}{pager}',
	'columns'       => [
		[
			'header'      => Yii::t( 'zr', 'Service' ),
			'name'        => 'description',
			'htmlOptions' => [ 'class' => 'service-name' ],
		],
		[
			'header'      => Yii::t( 'zr', 'Price' ),
			'name'        => 'price',
			'value'       => '$data->currentPrice->price',
			'htmlOptions' => [ 'class' => 'service-price' ],
			'type'        => 'number', // format as number
		],
		[
			'header' => Yii::t( 'zr', 'Create Date' ),
			'name'   => 'created_at',
			'value'  => '$data->currentPrice->created_at',
			'type'   => 'datetime', // format as date and time
		],
		[
			'class'    => 'CButtonColumn',
		],
	],
] ); ?>
```

In other places we can format number like:

```php
<?= Yii::app()->format->formatNumber( "6632678.64857" ); ?>
```
